intro: Ficus xanthophylla, commonly known as the yellow-leaf fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that often exhibit a yellowish tint on the underside. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible figs that are typically green when mature. Ficus xanthophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
